place_description: Charlotte Mecklenburg Library is the library system serving Mecklenburg County, NC with 20 locations and a digital online site. Our mission is to improve lives and build a stronger community. We create a community of readers and empower individuals.

reviews_data.review_text: Tu Shu Guan Sui Ran Bu Da ,Dan Shi Huan Jing Hen Bu Cuo ,Xue Xi Qi Fen Nong Hou .

I had to visit this south Blvd location to use their computers & print some documents. The two library clerks were amazing, I was helped to get a new library card & help with printing my documents as this was the 1st time at this library . Very helpful & nice

Just wanted to say thank you! I work in the city but live in a different county. Sometimes if I have a spare moment, I walk around a library and look at covers to help me decide what to read. A librarian here paused to ask me if I needed anything, and we had a brief convo where I explained my situation and how I mostly do audiobooks and ebooks. She asked if I'd heard of hoopla. I didn't think my county had a subscription, but lo and behold! They do!
Yet another way I can imbibe literature on my rides. Thank you for helping someone not even in your county :)
Amazing staff!!! Spacious, with rooms available for meetings and events. Convenient location with plenty of parking in the back.

i needed to print off several documents and decided to try the public library. lots of parking. the desktop computers are visible right when you walk in. in order to use the computers, you need a library card or a guest pass. you can get a guest pass from the desk (right next to the computers) very easily, you just need your ID. the folks at the desk were very kind, patient, and helpful. you can print in black and white for $0.25 per sheet, and in color for $0.50. the computers are numbered, so once you are done sending all your files for print, just go to the desk you got your guest pass from and ask if they can submit all the "print jobs" from your computer number. i had like 10 different "jobs," and was worried my documents would get mixed up with someone else's, but they submit all the jobs from the computer at once, all in order, and it was very easy. they also have a stapler!! much easier and more convenient than i expected. i went on a saturday afternoon and it was not crowded at all.

This location is always closed at the most inconvenient times. The drop box is always taped up as well. I went multiple times during the week-early afternoon and it's closed. I may have to find another location near me

Today between the hours of 2pm-3pm myself and my client was discriminated against and treated as if we were not welcomed or wanted at the library today. I work for a company which we assist those with disabilities, non violent and truly gifted. Today at South Boulevard public library. At this location I was approached by security asking if I had children, I informed her I was with my client and he is autistic, about three minutes later a library employee approached me asking if I had children I stated I'm with my client and he is autistic. She stated to me my client had left out of the building, which he would never leave me. He was standing around the corner texting on his phone not bothering anyone which she could see him from the front desk, he loves to tour new libraries. She then stated we could not be in the childrens area and told us to sit at a different location within the library. I asked her was that listed in the policy that we could not be in the childrens section. She stated yes it was against the rules and we could not sit in the childrens section of the library. Myself and my client travel to different libraries within Charlotte multiple times a week and never have we been told that we couldn't be in the children's section of any library we have toured. He enjoys being in the children's section reading and looking at children's books they are his favorite. It really saddened me to have experience something like this. I returned to the library to speak with the branch leader Ms.Beatriz and informed her of how myself and my client was treated while in the facility and that I felt like we had been discriminated agaisnt and mistreated by the actions of the employee working there and how I felt about the situation. My client was sad and was disappointed because we have never had these type of issues.Ms. Beatriz the branch leader also stated in the policy it stated that we could not be in the childrens sections of the library. The pamphlet she showed me did not state such a thing, just informed you of what they have in the library. I tried reaching out to Ms.Beatriz by phone to file a complaint and was informed by Mr.O that she was not available. She seemed very nonchalant and brushed the situation off.
I always stop By to use the wifi
I would like too thank Ms. Megan for helping me . You need more workers like her .. makes coming worth while .. thanks  Megan

The library is nice overall, it was quiet and clean. The reason this library doesn't get 5 starts is because I am a teen and I was sitting in the teen section, I'm also a university student but I'm not overage for the teen section. A young white lady employee came up to me and asked if I was a student, I said yes because I am, then she asked what school I went to and I told her. She automatically assumed I was too old to be in the section instead of asking me my age or for ID she asked me to move into a study room. I immediately felt disappointed because she didn't do her due diligence and I'm just trying to get my work done. Not all college student are 20-21-22. Some of us are 17&18. At first I was going to just go to the study room but then I decided I should just leave because I no longer felt welcome. I should have asked her name but I didn't. I will not be returning to this location.

Librarians are helpful and kind. Library is well organized and very clean, placing holds is easy on their app, checkout is simple and you don't even have to talk to anyone lol, most times of the day, it is quiet. Great place to study or do work. They have computers that you can use if you need them but they have public WiFi too. You can reserve an office space or study room for yourself which is great if you need a little extra privacy. Pleasantly surprised by this library.
Not a lot of parking spots in the front lot but more in the back. Have never had a problem with parking though.
+ all their services are free
Great selection of books.  Excellent customer service.  Very clean and well maintained.
Great staff, great location, super easy to get a library card. Also includes a computer lab, study rooms, and has printing services.
It is the maximum for studies! Destiny for all ages! I love it!
I would like too thank Ms. Hollie Rode , for helping me  she made coming too this library worthwhile while great positive attitude very helpful. Need more employees like  her   thanks "" Hollie"".

Great Library brand New building from the ground up. If you want a Library card you have to have your identification card and a bill from your home or lease agreement which is a bit much to me identification should be enough.
Very clean, a lot of resources and information.
That was my first time the lady had helped me get a card and vote rest. Alp.
Very clean, books are very organized. People at the help desk are friendly and very knowledgeable about the library and community.

It's pretty quiet!
I know it's a library but that is not always the case at libraries. My favorite part of this particular one is the "Study Rooms". Daily, you can come in and request a study room (if it is open of course) for 2 hours just to be to yourself and work on whatever you need to work on.

At home I wish I had space like that but not quite yet ... LoL

The staff is friendly and funny. I don't speak Spanish but the staff is definitely ready for those that do.

My wife attends a class/meet-up just to speak Spanish with Spanish speaking people and for those Spanish speaking people to get to test out their English.

This library has a steady calendar of activities usually going on. The times when those are happening it isn't the quietest but nothing is overbearing.
Hot librarian
Much better than the old location. Everything new looks like a regional library. Both the oriental store and library relocate here.
Staff was very helpful

This location is very nice and it's in a good location.  The homeless are allowed to come in and stay cool which is a plus.  I had an issue today with the one of the study rooms and I was  very irriated and I was not happy with the way it was handled by the employee. They need to make sure that everyone understands the new policy for the work study rooms .  And the lady that handled it needs  to show compassion.
This was such a cute library that had all the good vibes!  There were several study rooms that they allowed you to book even if you didn't have a library card!

I love  the new facility. I went to the old one and was so confused it was like a new business and I was lost then I kept walking down on my Google Maps gps and arrived at the new location.

So grateful to see it and I went today briefly,but that's my new liberty spot.

They have quiet book reading room, deals for you to work at and free wifi . Also you can reserve the computer with a library or guest card.

Even have a cute kids section for the youth to do practically the same things

Plenty of activities listed on the calendar  to not be bored and useful resources.

Even the Queen Charlotte is there . #itakegreatpics
A very nice branch, clean and well kept. Plenty of study spaces.

Wow, I nice little library gem on busy South Blvd! It was only by chance I found out about this location due to having a business meeting selected here. The library itself is right off of the main street, so you can easily miss it if you are going to fast on the Boulevard. That is about my only observed downfall, which motorists can appreciate if you are using GPS especially! Inside, the library was clean, organized, and had a nice modern feel. The help was friendly, and courteous. You feel the open space inside and will be able to take tour time with the purpose of your visit. Recommend taking the  little ones to experience what a local Charlotte based library outside of uptown should feel like
Very friendly, helpful staff. If you are looking for COVID TEST kits they have them on Thursdays. Tell them P. Zach send you. It should get you places.
Good selection of new materials and ample seating for studying.
Muy bien adentro. Muy amplio. Pero. El parking. Es muy pequeno y reducido
I haven't been since the covid but it looks to be remodeled.  it is very nice and roomy and quiet in there.
They were so nice. My library card has expired and they help me get a new one  And the reserved my book for me
It was such a great experience....the staff was so kind and helpful.
They let me eat a raw onion in there I love that place
Printing is free, librarians were very helpful, and even stopped to ask if my 8yr old wanted to do art.

First time here. I love the layout, look, and style. Very welcoming and clean.
The children's section fantastic

This is the nicest branch of the Charlotte Mecklenburg Library that I've been to. It was just recently redone.

I don't go to the library often anymore since I just get e-books online through their digital program. This isn't my normal branch, but I was running errands and in the area.

As a millennial that doesn't own a printer, I really appreciate that the library has free printing. You can print from a computer or they also have a mobile app you can upload documents to print.

I highly recommend forgoing your printer and just using the library!
Great place!
Very nice and renovated place I was attended by a very friendly and helpful Latin girl.The two people who attend are very friendly
Gave veterans free used computers
Got my free laptop today...they were very nice . delivered it to my car
Brand new, clean, helpful staff!
One word. It was great I needed help on the computer they gave me the help I needed.New building new location,
Top of the line when it fully opens(Covid-19). Very spacious and organized. That old Scalybark smell is NOT missed!

Love the new S. Blvd Library & location. Formerly Scaley Bark, the check out materials are better. The study rooms are great, plenty of computers and seating areas. They have vending machines.  Love It!
Love the new branch! Great selection and beautiful space.
Great
Love this location!

The police/security man tells you to get out if you get a phone call but he talks out loud with others in the room and nobody can tell him anything. Please correct yourself first if you are the leading example. I understand little talks as long as they're not loud and mindful of others around.
I love taking my toddler to story time here! Ms. Erin is the best! We bring the whole family a few times a week to play and check out books. Everyone is very friendly and helpful.
An outstanding public service that is always clean, organized and staffed by helpful, friendly folks. A great credit to our city.
Great library with a great selection of books, DVD's and music! Staff is extremely friendly and very helpful! This is one of the best libraries in Charlotte, NC!
Friendliest staff ever. You will be helped and you will feel better than when you came in!
Great neighborhood library. It is always full of people.
The staff is knowledgeable , the selection is small but eclectic, the security guard is a mainstay and the WiFi corner is a dream  another perfect PLCMC Branch!
Helpful people!

I love this place granted the location is small due to it being a neighborhood branch and those seeking a bigger facility should go elsewhere. While the size may dissuade some I find it enjoyable the staff is always more than willing to help me out when need be.
Very helpful librarians

Scaleybark

Small parking lot, but they are in a center so there is other parking around.
Very small branch, you can see the whole place when you walk in.
Restrooms with a changing table.
Older crowd during early hours.
Friendly staff.
Has a teen zone
Couple of adult computers
Large selection of books for sale
Children's area is small and separated by book shelves.
Two kids computers.
A kitchen set with lots of food.
Bins organized by toy groups.
Puzzles.
Train table.
Magnetic board with letters.
Kid tables and chairs.
Good sized DVD collection.
Large easy reader section.

Overall a nice library, but the lack of space makes you feel like you have to be EXTRA quiet to not bother others.
Niceeee
Nice place..

Very small branch and extremely loud. I wouldn't recommend coming here to study or read unless you can ignore the noise. Still, the branch is clean and well maintained, with a number of computers available for those who need them.

I was followed around the library like I was going to steal something I just got off megabus coming from Atlanta and I needed to print tickets for carowinds but since this employee was following my every move I left the library
I am here at the library
